text_summary: Non-contrast CT head protocol for acute neurological emergencies. Rapid acquisition with thin sections for hemorrhage detection. Standard first-line imaging for head trauma and stroke.
clinical_indication: Acute headache, trauma, altered mental status, stroke symptoms, intracranial hemorrhage screening
preprocessing_steps: Brain window (W:80 L:40), bone window (W:2500 L:500), posterior fossa reconstruction

text_summary: Low-dose CT chest screening protocol for early lung cancer detection in high-risk patients. Reduced radiation dose with maintained spatial resolution for nodule detection.
clinical_indication: Lung cancer screening in adults age 50-80 with 20+ pack-year smoking history per USPSTF guidelines
preprocessing_steps: Lung window (W:1500 L:-600), mediastinal window (W:400 L:40), MIP reconstructions, CAD nodule detection

text_summary: CT pulmonary angiography (CTPA) protocol optimized for pulmonary embolism detection with bolus-triggered contrast injection and ECG gating for reduced cardiac motion artifact.
clinical_indication: Suspected acute pulmonary embolism, elevated D-dimer, Wells score intermediate-high
preprocessing_steps: Bolus tracking at main PA (threshold 120 HU), lung window, mediastinal window, RV/LV ratio measurement, sagittal/coronal reformats

text_summary: CT abdomen and pelvis with intravenous contrast in portal venous phase for comprehensive abdominal evaluation. Oral contrast optional based on clinical indication.
contrast_agent: iodinated IV (100-120mL at 3 mL/s), optional oral contrast
clinical_indication: Abdominal pain, suspected abscess, malignancy staging, appendicitis, diverticulitis, bowel obstruction
preprocessing_steps: Soft tissue window (W:400 L:40), liver window (W:150 L:70), bone window, coronal and sagittal reformats

text_summary: MRI brain with and without gadolinium contrast for comprehensive evaluation of intracranial pathology. Includes pre- and post-contrast T1, T2, FLAIR, DWI, and SWI sequences.
clinical_indication: Brain tumor evaluation, metastatic workup, infection, vascular malformation, post-operative assessment
preprocessing_steps: Sagittal T1, axial T2, axial FLAIR, axial DWI/ADC, axial SWI, post-contrast axial and coronal T1

text_summary: MRI brain MS protocol with high-resolution FLAIR and post-contrast sequences optimized for detection and monitoring of demyelinating lesions per McDonald criteria.
clinical_indication: Multiple sclerosis diagnosis, disease monitoring, relapse assessment, treatment response evaluation
preprocessing_steps: 3D FLAIR (1mm isotropic), 3D T1 pre/post-contrast, axial T2, DWI, sagittal FLAIR, double inversion recovery (DIR), lesion subtraction maps

text_summary: MRI lumbar spine protocol for evaluation of disc herniation, spinal stenosis, and nerve root compression. Includes sagittal and axial T1 and T2-weighted sequences.
clinical_indication: Low back pain with radiculopathy, disc herniation, spinal stenosis, cauda equina syndrome
preprocessing_steps: Sagittal T1, sagittal T2, axial T2 through disc levels L3-S1, sagittal STIR, optional post-contrast T1 with fat sat

text_summary: Standard two-view chest radiograph protocol including posteroanterior (PA) and lateral projections for routine chest evaluation.
clinical_indication: Cough, dyspnea, chest pain, pre-operative evaluation, pneumonia workup, pleural effusion assessment
preprocessing_steps: Upright positioning, full inspiration, edge enhancement, automatic exposure control

text_summary: ECG-gated CT calcium scoring protocol for coronary artery calcification quantification using Agatston scoring. Non-contrast acquisition with prospective gating.
clinical_indication: Cardiovascular risk stratification in asymptomatic intermediate-risk patients, Agatston score quantification
preprocessing_steps: Prospective ECG gating at 70% R-R interval, 120 kVp, calcium threshold 130 HU, Agatston score calculation

text_summary: Cardiac MRI protocol for comprehensive functional and tissue characterization including cine SSFP, late gadolinium enhancement, and T1/T2 mapping sequences.
clinical_indication: Cardiomyopathy evaluation, myocardial viability, myocarditis, cardiac mass, congenital heart disease
preprocessing_steps: ECG gating, breath-hold cine SSFP (2/3/4 chamber, short axis stack), T2 STIR, pre-contrast T1 map, LGE at 10 minutes post-contrast, post-contrast T1 map

text_summary: CT neck with intravenous contrast for evaluation of cervical lymphadenopathy, masses, and soft tissue pathology from skull base through thoracic inlet.
clinical_indication: Cervical lymphadenopathy, neck mass, head and neck cancer staging, abscess, thyroid nodule evaluation
preprocessing_steps: Soft tissue window (W:350 L:50), bone window, coronal and sagittal reformats, 60-second delay post-injection

text_summary: Full-field digital mammography screening protocol with bilateral craniocaudal (CC) and mediolateral oblique (MLO) views for early breast cancer detection.
clinical_indication: Routine breast cancer screening for women age 40+ per ACR/ACS recommendations
preprocessing_steps: Standard CC and MLO positioning, automatic exposure control, CLAHE enhancement, CAD overlay generation

text_summary: High-resolution CT (HRCT) chest protocol with thin sections and prone imaging for evaluation of interstitial lung disease and diffuse parenchymal abnormalities.
clinical_indication: Interstitial lung disease evaluation, usual interstitial pneumonia, hypersensitivity pneumonitis, sarcoidosis
preprocessing_steps: Lung window (W:1500 L:-600), supine and prone acquisitions, expiratory series, sharp kernel reconstruction, MIP and MinIP reformats

text_summary: CT angiography of the head for acute stroke protocol with rapid acquisition from aortic arch through vertex. Optimized for detection of large vessel occlusion.
clinical_indication: Acute ischemic stroke with suspected large vessel occlusion, stroke triage for thrombectomy candidacy
preprocessing_steps: Bolus tracking at aortic arch, thin-section MIP, 3D volume rendering, automated LVO detection, ASPECTS scoring, CTP if available

text_summary: CT chest follow-up nodule protocol with limited coverage and reduced dose for interval assessment of previously identified pulmonary nodule per Lung-RADS recommendations.
clinical_indication: Interval follow-up of pulmonary nodule per Lung-RADS or Fleischner Society guidelines
preprocessing_steps: Lung window (W:1500 L:-600), volumetric nodule measurement, comparison with prior, volume doubling time calculation, CAD nodule tracking
